Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language created by Guido van Rossum. 
Key Features: Easy to read, dynamically typed, and has a massive standard library. 
Current Stable Version: Around 3.12 (versions change, please check official sources for the latest). 
Applications: Web development (Django, Flask), AI/ML, data science, automation, and more.

Java is a class-based, object-oriented programming language developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems. 
Key Features: Platform-independent (WORA - Write Once, Run Anywhere), robust, secure, and strongly typed. 
Current LTS Version: Java 21. 
Applications: Enterprise-level applications, Android app development, web backends, and big data.

JavaScript (JS) is a high-level programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web, created by Brendan Eich. 
Key Features: The language of web browsers for interactivity, multi-paradigm, and has a vast ecosystem (e.g., Node.js for backend). 
Current Standard: ECMAScript 2023 (ES14). 
Applications: Front-end web development, server-side development (Node.js), mobile apps (React Native), and game development.

C++ is a high-performance, general-purpose programming language created by Bjarne Stroustrup as an extension of the C language. 
Key Features: High performance, direct memory control, object-oriented, and system-level programming capabilities. 
Current Standard: C++23. 
Applications: Game engines (like Unreal Engine), operating systems, high-frequency trading, and performance-critical applications.

HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It's the standard markup language for creating web pages, invented by Tim Berners-Lee. 
Purpose: It describes the structure of a web page using elements like headings, paragraphs, images, and links. It is not a programming language. 
Current Version: HTML5.

CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. It's a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language like HTML, created by HÃ¥kon Wium Lie. 
Purpose: It controls the colors, fonts, layout, and overall visual appearance of web pages. 
Current Version: CSS3, which is modular and continuously evolving.

React (also known as React.js) is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces, created by Jordan Walke at Facebook. 
Key Features: Component-based architecture, uses a Virtual DOM for performance, and promotes declarative UI development. 
Current Version: Around 18.x (React evolves quickly, so always check the official docs). 
Applications: Building modern single-page applications (SPAs) and complex interactive web UIs.
